com.genband.kandy.api.provisioning

Interface IKandyProvisioning


  • public interface IKandyProvisioning

    Subscriber Provisioning

    This interface is used to handle subscriber provisioning.

    You can add subscribers in two ways:

    • Admin – can create (multiple) subscribers directly using the web GUI.

      click the link: https://portal.kandy.io/my-kandy
      and click on: Manage

    • Users – can create individual subscribers using the Reference Application:
      1. The user opens the application and is prompted for a username, password, and phone number
      2. The Kandy server sends an SMS to the supplied phone number, with a validation code
      3. The user enters this code to complete the registration process

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deactivate(KandyResponseListener listener)
      This method deactivates a currently active subscriber.

    • Method Detail

      • requestCode

        void requestCode(java.lang.String phoneNumber,
                 java.lang.String twoLetterISOCountryCode,
                 KandyResponseListener listener)

        Subscriber Provisioning

        You can add subscribers in two ways:

        • Admin – can create (multiple) subscribers directly using the web GUI.

          click the link: https://portal.kandy.io/my-kandy
          and click on: Manage

        • Users – can create individual subscribers using the Reference Application:
          1. The user opens the application and is prompted for a username, password, and phone number
          2. The Kandy server sends an SMS to the supplied phone number, with a validation code
          3. The user enters this code to complete the registration process

        Notes:

        • The parameter twoLetterISOCountryCode are two-letter country codes defined in ISO_3166. it can be received using the KandyLocationService.getCountryInfo(com.genband.kandy.api.services.location.KandyCountryInfoResponseListener) api
        • The verification method currently supports only SMS
        Example: 
         
 String username = "username@domain";
 String twoLetterISOCountryCode = "IL"
 
 Kandy.getProvisioning().requestCode(username, twoLetterISOCountryCode, new KandyResponseListener() {
 
 @Override
 public void onRequestFailed(int responseCode, String err) {
        //TODO insert your code here
 }
 
 @Override
 public void onRequestSucceded() {
        //TODO insert your code here
 }
 });
        Parameters:
        phoneNumber - The phone numer to subscriber with
        twoLetterISOCountryCode - The registerd phone numer twoLetterISOCountryCode
        listener - The callback that will be invoked
        See Also:
        ISO_3166, KandyLocationService#getCountryInfo(com.genband.kandy.api.services.location.KandyCountryInfoResponseListener)}

      • validate

        void validate(java.lang.String phoneNumber,
              java.lang.String validationCode,
              java.lang.String twoLetterISOCountryCode,
              KandyValidationResponseListener listener)
        This call sends the received code to the server for validation.

        Example: 

         
 String username = "username@domain";
 String validationCode = "1234";
 String twoLetterISOCountryCode = "IL";
 Kandy.getProvisioning().validate(username, validationCoide, twoLetterISOCountryCode, new KandyValidationResponseListener() {
 
 @Override
 public void onRequestFailed(int responseCode, String err) {
        //TODO insert your code here
 }
 
 @Override
 public void onRequestSuccess(IKandyValidationResponse response) {
        //TODO insert your code here
 }
 });
        Parameters:
        phoneNumber -
        validationCode -
        twoLetterISOCountryCode -
        listener - The callback that will be invoked

      • deactivate

        void deactivate(KandyResponseListener listener)
        This method deactivates a currently active subscriber.

        Example: 

         
 Kandy.getProvisioning().deactivate(new KandyResponseListener() {
 
     @Override
     public void onRequestFailed(int responseCode, String err) {
    //TODO insert your code here
     }
 
     @Override
    public void onRequestSucceded() {
    //TODO insert your code here
     }
 });
        Parameters:
